intro: Euryops subcarnosus subsp. subcarnosus, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow or orange ray florets and dark brown disk florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant flowers and drought tolerance.
